newsitem.title: JAPAN: Bankers Trust says no plan to take major NCB stake.
newsitem.headline: Bankers Trust says no plan to take major NCB stake.

text.p: Bankers Trust New York Corp does not plan to take a major equity stake in Nippon Credit Bank Ltd (NCB), Bankers Trust vice-chairman George Voita told a news conference on Friday.

At the same news conference, held to announce details of a tie-up between the two banks, NCB president Hiroshi Kubota said that the two were considering securitising 50 to 100 billion yen worth of real estate and other assets.
Another NCB official said the first securitisation products to be developed and marketed jointly with Bankers Trust will be offered in July.
Kubota also said that NCB does not plan to have any Bankers Trust executives sit on its board of directors.
He blasted Moody's Investors Service, a rating agency, for assigning low ratings to the long-term credit bank.

"(The rating) is full of misunderstandings and it is unacceptable," he said, when asked his view of the fact that Moody's had not raised NCB's ratings despite the announcement two weeks ago of a tie-up with Bankers Trust to help it securitise some of its loans.
Asked about securitisation opportunities in Japan, Bankers Trust's Voita said, "We believe securitisation has many possible applications in the Japanese market."
He also said Bankers Trust intended to continue its existing relationships with other Japanese banks.

NCB, burdened with a heavy load of problem loans, unveiled a restructuring plan on April 1 under which it would retreat from overseas operations, sell prime real estate and float new shares to try to rebuild its capital base.
